intro: Persicaria erectominor, commonly known as slender polygonum, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late summer. Persicaria erectominor is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
